intro: Sykesia walkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Sykesia walkeri thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires partial shade for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
